structure.unit: PHYSICIANS, OSTEOPATHS, PODIATRISTS, AND RELATED MEDICAL PRACTITIONERS

law.catch_line: Court-appointed fiduciary bound by terms of grantor's advance directive -- Power of surrogate to act.
law.text: If, following the execution of an advance directive under KRS 311.623, a court of the grantor's principal domicile appoints a fiduciary charged with the care and protection of the grantor's person, the fiduciary shall be bound by the terms of the grantor's advance directive. If the advance directive designates a surrogate to make health care decisions for the grantor, the surrogate may continue to act.
law.history: Created 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 421, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1998.
